author: Special Correspondent
text:
Figurines being created in all parks in the coastal city

An artist creating a sand sculpture to ensure 100 per cent voting as part of voter awareness campaign at Pearl City Beach in Thoothukudi on Friday.— Photo: N. Rajesh

The Muthu Nagar beach attracted huge crowd on Friday that enjoyed the voter awareness sand art created by 36-year-old sand artist Sashi Varma of Osaravilai near Kanayakumari.

As the Election Commission of India is keen on achieving cent per cent voter turnout in the May 16 Assembly polls, all District Election Officers have been instructed to intensify voter awareness campaigns.

Roped-in

On his part, Thoothukudi Sub-Collector S. Gopala Sundararaj, who is also the Returning Officer of Thoothukudi Assembly segment, has roped in Mr. Sashi Varma in this exercise.

After spending over six hours for creating the sand art, Mr. Sashi Varma, a postgraduate in fine arts, said that he had created over 100 sand arts and sculptures on the beaches of Goa, Chennai, Kanyakumari, Kovalam and Mamallapuram on a range of topics.

More to come

“I’ve planned to create sand arts on a few more beaches during the run-up to the polls to create awareness among voters, who should actively participate in the democratic process of election,” Mr. Sashi Varma said.

The voter awareness figurines are being created in almost all parks in the coastal city.
title: Voter awareness sand art emerges as crowd-puller
